item.title: Copyright Royalty and Distribution Reform Act of 2004

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H9845-9847)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H9845-9847)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty mintues of debate on S. Con. Res. 145.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H9845-9848)
Mr. Sensenbrenner moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S11392-11393; text as passed Senate: CR S11392-11393; text of measure as introduced: CR S11383-11384)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S11392-11393; text as passed Senate: CR S11392-11393; text of measure as introduced: CR S11383-11384)

summary.text: Authorizes the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 1417 (Copyright Royalty and Distribution Reform Act of 2004), including to provide that such Act shall apply to proceedings to determine royalty rates for the secondary transmission of primary transmissions by satellite carriers that are commenced after January 31, 2006.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Authorizes the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 1417 (Copyright Royalty and Distribution Reform Act of 2004), including to provide that such Act shall apply to proceedings to determine royalty rates for the secondary transmission of primary transmissions by satellite carriers that are commenced after January 31, 2006.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Authorizes the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 1417 (Copyright Royalty and Distribution Reform Act of 2004), including to provide that such Act shall apply to proceedings to determine royalty rates for the secondary transmission of primary transmissions by satellite carriers that are commenced after January 31, 2006.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
